description: Master the arc of the legendary fireball to defeat moving targets in this precision timing challenge.
rationale: Focuses on projectile physics and predictive timing, providing a high-value environment for AI agents to learn ballistic trajectories and moving target interception within the familiar Mario universe.
details: A single-screen skill game where the player character (Mario) is fixed on a left-side platform. Targets (Goombas, Koopas, or floating blocks) move at varying speeds from right to left or vertically. The player can only throw fireballs with a fixed bounce physics. The game simulates gravity-affected projectiles that bounce once or twice before disappearing. Difficulty increases as targets become smaller, faster, and follow unpredictable patterns. The environment is rendered using vector graphics for clean performance.
how_to_build: uv init && uv add pygame && uv lock
how_to_stop: kill -9 $(pgrep -f 'python main.py') or press the ESC key
how_to_play: Score points by hitting enemies with fireballs. Use the 'SPACE' key to launch a fireball. The fireball follows a parabolic trajectory and bounces on the ground. Timing is critical as you must predict where the target will be when the fireball reaches it. Hitting multiple enemies with a single bounce grants bonus points. Game over occurs if 3 enemies pass the left boundary without being hit.

technical_specs.observation_space: Pixel data or [target_x, target_y, target_speed, fireball_x, fireball_y]
